answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!If you have  problems adjusting to temperature changes then there are three main things you should test for: thyroid problems, diabetes and anemia. Other than that it can also be a vasovagal attack in response to temperature change. Please consult your PCP for primary examination followed by proper referral.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

I'm new here, but this happens to me 24/7 and has ever since I had a total hysterectomy at the age of 28.  Haven't been on HRT for 8 years,  This sounds like surgical menopause/need of HRT.  Just a thought.
